title: Social Media Utilization Strategies Based on Scientific Inquiry in Nursing and Midwifery Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic nursing and midwifery practical experience, digital device usage proficiency, foundational understanding of scientific inquiry methods (hypothesis formulation, experimental design, data analysis).
context.additional_context: Focuses on enhancing educational effectiveness by utilizing social media tools accessible via smartphones for current practitioners. Applies an improvement process through data-driven analysis (developing metrics, comparing results) and continuous observation (feedback collection).

learning_goals: Analyze platform-specific characteristics and educational applications of social media using scientific inquiry methods (hypothesis-experiment-analysis) to develop nursing/midwifery educational materials.

Design non-face-to-face education strategies using social media during COVID-19 following hypothesis-experiment-analysis procedures considering scientific variables (accessibility, interaction frequency) and apply them to practical cases.
Conceptualize a social media-based interprofessional education model considering scientific variables (learning effectiveness, engagement, collaboration efficiency) for practical implementation.
Learners can adhere to professional ethics guidelines in online learning communities and perform evidence-based interactions (case studies, data sharing).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
